questions.question_text: Which is a minimum requirement when applying the “business case” theme?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. Using lessons to assist in the development of the project business justification and reassessment.

In PRINCE2, the Business Case theme is crucial for ensuring that the project remains viable and justifiable throughout its lifecycle. One of the minimum requirements of this theme is that lessons learned from previous projects are used to inform and improve the development of the business case, as well as its ongoing reassessment. This helps ensure that the business case remains relevant and aligned with the project's goals and objectives.

Selected Answer: B
PRINCE2 emphasizes using lessons learned from previous projects to help in the development and ongoing reassessment of the business case. This ensures that the business justification remains valid throughout the project and that decisions are informed by past experiences.

B is correct; In PRINCE2, the Business Case theme ensures that the project is aligned with organizational objectives and provides a viable justification for its initiation and continuation. The minimum requirements for applying the Business Case theme include:

Ensuring there is a valid business justification for the project.
Using lessons learned to develop and reassess the business justification throughout the project.

The correct answer is B

A minimum requirement in the PRINCE2 Business Case theme is to use lessons learned from previous projects to help develop and continuously reassess the business justification. This ensures that the business case remains relevant and that past experiences inform current decisions, contributing to the project's overall viability and alignment with organizational goals.

questions.question_text: Which statement about the role of the project manager is CORRECT?

discussion.content:
C is correct; Why the other options are incorrect:

A. The project manager must not delegate any responsibilities: Delegation is an essential part of project management. The project manager can delegate tasks to the project team but remains accountable for the overall project.
B. The project manager must not take on an additional role: While it's generally recommended that the project manager focuses on their core role, there might be situations where taking on an additional role is necessary, especially in smaller projects.
C. The project manager role must not be shared: While it's usually best to have a single project manager for clarity and accountability, there might be cases where sharing the role is appropriate, such as in very large or complex projects.

questions.question_text: Which stakeholder interest does the supplier representative represent?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Those providing maintenance and support services after project closure

Explanation:
The supplier representative in PRINCE2 represents the interests of those who provide the specialist products, expertise, and resources required by the project. This includes ensuring that the project’s deliverables are feasible from a technical standpoint and that appropriate maintenance and support services will be available after project closure. They ensure that the products can be supported and maintained effectively post-project.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. Those ensuring the project delivers value for money during the project.

In PRINCE2, the supplier representative represents the interests of the suppliers and contractors involved in the project, ensuring that the project delivers value for money. Their focus is typically on ensuring the project's products are delivered efficiently, within budget, and meet the agreed-upon quality and specifications. They are primarily concerned with the delivery aspects, such as cost control, resource management, and supplier performance.

Selected Answer: C
The supplier representative's primary interest is in ensuring that the project delivers value for money, particularly in terms of the resources and services they provide. They are concerned with the cost-effectiveness and efficiency of the project to ensure that the supplier’s contributions meet the project’s requirements and expectations. This interest aligns with their role in overseeing the delivery of products and services that fulfill the project’s objectives while adhering to budget constraints.

7.2.1.4 Senior supplier
The senior supplier represents the interests of those designing, developing, facilitating, procuring and implementing the project product.
This role is accountable for the quality of products delivered by the supplier(s) and is responsible for the technical integrity of the project. This role will include providing supplier resources to the project and ensuring that proposals for designing and developing the products are feasible and realistic.
In many cases, the senior supplier also represents the interests of those who will provide the maintenance services for the specialist products after closure of the project (e.g. engineering maintenance and support). Exceptions to this do occur, however (e.g. when the maintenance services are provided by the customer organization, such as an internal IT department, or are outsourced to a different supplier).

Which is a minimum requirement for the “quality” theme?

choices.A: Lessons must be used to inform the definition of quality expectations
choices.C: A benefits management approach must be produced and maintained
choices.D: An issue register must be maintained for quality issues including off-specifications
choices.B: A communication management approach must be produced and maintained

discussion.content: Mod please change this is confusing to learn.

A is correct;

Why the other options are not the minimum:

B. A communication management approach must be produced and maintained: While important for communication, this is not specifically related to the Quality theme.
C. A benefits management approach must be produced and maintained: This focuses on benefits realization, not the core of the Quality theme.
D. An issue register must be maintained for quality issues including off-specifications: While important for tracking issues, the minimum requirement is about proactively using lessons to define quality expectations.

Selected Answer: A
This is a minimum requirement for the "quality" theme in PRINCE2, ensuring that past experiences help set clear quality criteria for the project.
